title:
Adaptive vibration condition monitoring technology for local tooth damage in
gearboxes.

references.title: Gelman Adaptive sequential analysis with variable thresholds.
references.raw: L. M. Gelman Adaptive sequential analysis with variable thresholds. Telecommunications and Radio Engineering 38(9), 75-78, 1983

references.title: Gelman Estimate of the amplitude modulation factor of noise by a random signal,
references.raw: L. M. Gelman Estimate of the amplitude modulation factor of noise by a random signal, Telecommunications and Radio Engineering, vol. 47(1), pp. 65-67, 1993

references.title: Handbook on Pattern Recognition and Computer Vision.
references.raw: C. Chen, L. Pau, and P. Wang Handbook on Pattern Recognition and Computer Vision. World Scientific Publishing Company, Inc., 1993

references.title: Image Pattern Recognition.
references.raw: V. A. Kovalevsky, Image Pattern Recognition. Springer-Verlag. 1980

references.title: Krytsyn Automatic adaptive method for testing data processing for nondestructive testing in civil engineering.
references.raw: L. M. Gelman, Yu. V. Burau, and V. I. Krytsyn Automatic adaptive method for testing data processing for nondestructive testing in civil engineering. Proceedings of the International Symposium of Nondestructive Testing in Civil Engineering Berlin, Germany 1311-1317, 1995

references.title: Passive-active low-frequency vibroacoustical fault diagnosis method, 52 Meeting of the Society for Machinery Failure Prevention Technology,
references.raw: L. M. Gelman. Bouraou N. I. Passive-active low-frequency vibroacoustical fault diagnosis method,  52 Meeting of the Society for Machinery Failure Prevention Technology, Virginia Beach, USA, 1998

references.title: Udovenko Condition monitoring diagnosis methods of helicopter units.
references.raw: L. M. Gelman, D. A. Kripak, V.V. Fedorov, and L.N. Udovenko Condition monitoring diagnosis methods of helicopter units. Mechanical Systems and Signal Processing 14(4), 613-624, .2000

abstract:
An adaptive approach was applied for local tooth damage diagnostics in
gearboxes. The expediency of adaptation was proved experimentally for the new
diagnostic feature, the sum of normalized sideband amplitudes. The positive
correlation between mesh amplitudes and their sideband amplitudes was found
experimentally for the first time. Novel adaptive vibration condition monitoring
technology for local tooth damage in gearboxes was developed and experimentally
validated. The experimental results showed an increase in effectiveness of the
diagnostics when the adaptive technology was used
